description: A soccer coach uploads a full‑match video, the PlayMinder Coach analyzes off‑ball movement patterns that produced the three goals, then returns tactical insights, actionable recommendations for a quick counter‑attack approach, and a visual diagram of the suggested player movements.

messages.content: You are PlayMinder Coach, an expert virtual sports strategy assistant. Your job is to ingest game footage, pull player statistics, run pattern‑recognition analyses, generate data‑driven coaching recommendations, and create clear visualizations for coaches. Use the available tools to fulfil user requests.

We just played a soccer match against Rivals FC. Here’s the full‑match video: https://example.com/match123.mp4. I want to know what off‑ball movement patterns our wingers and midfielders used that led to our three goals. Also give me advice on how to improve our transition play using a quick counter‑attack tactic.
I’ll start by downloading the video and extracting its metadata.
Great, the video is stored. Now I’ll fetch the latest stats for the wingers and midfielders who were on the pitch.
I’ll now analyse the video together with the player‑stat data to discover off‑ball movement patterns that preceded each of the three goals.

Based on the identified patterns, I’ll generate coaching recommendations aimed at sharpening a quick counter‑attack approach and visualise the advised movements.

{"recommendation_id": "rec_555", "recommendations": [{"title": "Exploit Deep Drops of Wingers", "detail": "Train wingers to periodically drop into half‑space during possession phases, allowing the central midfielder to time diagonal runs. Emphasise a quick one‑two with the nearest winger to accelerate the transition."}, {"title": "Quick Overlap Triggers", "detail": "Instruct full‑backs to push high only after the winger has made the overlap run, creating a brief numerical superiority on the flank. Use a short, low pass to the overlapping winger to launch the counter‑attack."}, {"title": "Midfield Pivot on Turnovers", "detail": "When regaining possession, the central midfielder should receive the ball with back‑to‑goal, draw the nearest defender, then release a crisp pass to the winger making a forward run. Practice this in small‑sided drills with limited touches."}]}"

### Off‑ball patterns that led to the three goals
1. **Goal 1 – Right‑winger drop & midfield diagonal run** – The right winger’s drop created a channel for the central midfielder to cut inside and receive a through ball.
2. **Goal 2 – Left‑winger overlap & opposite‑wing cut‑in** – A high‑speed overlap pulled the defender away, opening space for the opposite winger.
3. **Goal 3 – Midfield‑winger one‑two at the edge of the box** – A rapid one‑two between the midfielder and right winger split the defense, allowing a clear shot.

### Recommendations for a quick counter‑attack tactic
- **Exploit deep drops of wingers** – Incorporate drills where wingers intentionally drop into half‑spaces to invite diagonal runs from midfielders.
- **Quick overlap triggers** – Program full‑backs to time their forward runs only after the winger initiates the overlap, then deliver a short, fast pass to start the break.
- **Midfield pivot on turnovers** – Coach the central midfielder to receive the ball back‑to‑goal and immediately pivot it to a forward‑running winger.

You can view a visual diagram of the recommended movements here: https://playminder.com/visuals/rec_555.png

Feel free to ask for deeper drill designs or how to integrate these concepts into your next training session.
